headline: Trump says he will allow Nvidia to sell some AI chips in China
summary: President Donald Trump said the United States would permit NVIDIA to ship its H200 AI chips to approved customers in China, effectively ending an export ban.

raw.headline: Trump says he will allow Nvidia to sell some AI chips in China
raw.summary: President Donald Trump said the United States would permit NVIDIA to ship its H200 AI chips to approved customers in China, effectively ending an export ban.

headline: US to allow Nvidia to ship H200 chips to China, Trump says
summary: U.S. President Donald Trump said ​on Monday that ‌he will allow Nvidia ‌to ship its H200 chips to approved customers in China and ⁠other countries, ‌under conditions that allow for continued ‍strong national security.  The U.S. Department of Commerce is finalizing ​the details, and ‌the same approach will apply to AMD, Intel, and other U.S. companies, Trump said in ⁠a post ​on X.

headline: Nvidia Stock Rises After Trump Approves H200 Chip Sales to China
summary: President Donald Trump plans to allow  Nvidia  to sell a more advanced AI chip to China.  Trump seemed to imply Nvidia will pay a 25% fee on any H200 sales to China, adding: “$25% will be paid to the United States of America.”  Nvidia didn’t immediately respond to a request for comment on Trump’s post.

headline: A Key Moment for AI Stocks Comes This Week—and It Has Nothing to Do With Nvidia
summary: The artificial-intelligence trade that has fueled the market’s rally can swing in either direction this week, with earnings from  Oracle  being the pivotal event.  The market’s focus on AI growth has widened from just looking at Nvidia’s chip demand.  Wall Street is rightly concerned about how sustainable the growth in data center demand is, and investors are becoming increasingly vigilant of demand signals from a host of key companies.

headline: Don't bet against the Fed, Oracle's Larry Ellison: Fmr. Cisco CEO
summary: JC2 Ventures founder and CEO John Chambers, who was formerly the CEO of Cisco (CSCO), joins Opening Bid host Brian Sozzi to talk about the ongoing artificial intelligence (AI) trade and share which Big Tech leaders and players he's watching, including Oracle's (ORCL) Larry Ellison, Microsoft's (MSFT) Satya Nadella, and AMD's (AMD) Lisa Su. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Opening Bid.

headline: Trump greenlights Nvidia H200 AI chip sales to China if U.S. gets 25% cut, says Xi responded positively
summary: Nvidia and chip rival Advanced Micro Devices agreed over the summer to share 15% of the revenue from China chip sales with the U.S. government.

headline: This Week In AI Chips - Synopsys Faces Legal Challenges Amid Revenue and Income Decline
summary: Synopsys, Inc., a provider of design automation software for integrated circuits, has recently faced legal challenges following a significant stock decline. The company’s Design IP segment, which includes AI-driven silicon components, reported a 7.7% year-over-year decline in revenue and a 43% drop in net income for the third quarter of 2025. This downturn is attributed to increased customization demands from customers, impacting profitability and prompting considerations for a change in...
